air.translation[0].definitions[0].defini: the mixture of gases around the Earth, that we breathe
air.translation[0].definitions[0].exampl: Let’s go outside and get some fresh air.
You need to put some air in the tyres.
There was a strong smell of burning in the air.
air.translation[0].definitions[1].defini: travelling by, or using, a plane
air.translation[0].definitions[1].exampl: I’d prefer to travel by air.
air.translation[0].definitions[2].exampl: the victims of Britain’s worst air disaster
His brother died in an air crash.
air.translation[0].definitions[3].defini: if something or someone has an air of confidence, mystery etc, they seem confident, mysterious etc
air.translation[0].definitions[3].exampl: She looked at him with a determined air.
She had an air of quiet confidence.
air.translation[0].definitions[4].defini: a simple tune, often used in the title of a piece of classical music
air.translation[0].note_box[0].sections[: She opened the window to let in some fresh air.
London’s air is cleaner than it has been at any time since 1585.
Warm air rises and is replaced by cooler and denser air.
I felt a sudden rush of hot air.
The air had turned a little cooler.
I looked up to the stars in the clear night air.
The air in Mexico City is heavily polluted.
The room was full of stale air and tobacco smoke.
People cannot live up there because the air is too thin and there is not enough oxygen to breathe.
He stepped out and breathed in the cold morning air.
the salty smell of the sea air
Smoke from the chimneys hung in the still air.
Most air pollution is caused by cars.
The air quality is very poor on hot days.
I went outside for a breath of air.
There was a cold rush of air as she wound down her window.
The birds are able to glide on a current of warm air.
She breathed in the cool mountain air.
He clutched his throat as he fought for air.
It would be nice to open the door and let in some air.
I need to put some air in the tyres.
air.translation[0].note_box[1].heading: GRAMMAR: Patterns with air
You say that something is in the air
The plane was in the air
Put your hands in the air!
The plane was on the air
You say that something goes up into the air
The plane went up into the air
You say that a TV or radio programme is on the air or on air  (=it is broadcast)
The show has been on the air for over 30 years
air.translation[1].definitions[0].exampl: Staff will get a chance to ask questions and air their views.
air.translation[1].definitions[1].defini: to broadcast a programme on television or radio
air.translation[1].definitions[1].exampl: KPBS airs such popular children’s programs as ‘Barney’ and ‘Sesame Street’.
The program is due to air next month.
air.translation[1].definitions[2].defini: to let fresh air into a room, especially one that has been closed for a long time
air.translation[1].definitions[3].defini: to put a piece of clothing in a place that is warm or has a lot of air, so that it smells clean
air.translation[1].definitions[3].exampl: I’ve left my sweater outside to air.
